Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT
Reviews.Author: Aaron McNamara
Reviews.Content: Gave this TV 5 stars because it is phenomenal!I received my product in 2 days with Amazon Prime so shipping was right on time like promised. The factory settings on the TV are decent but you can make the picture look EXCELLENT if you tweak the settings to your liking. The picture is crisp and clear, making anything you watch way more enjoyable. The sound is also exceptional! It has the potential to be very loud if you put it on the "Amplify" setting which is located in your menu settings, and the speakers are in the back for those of you who are wondering.As for the reviews about the apps not working, I did not have this problem. It seems that a lot of those reviews occurred awhile ago so they might have fixed that problem they were having. I turned the TV on and there was an update & everything works perfectly fine!As for gaming, this TV is the best you can get at this price and anything below it. The input lag is 88ms but when you put it on PC mode it reduces the input lag to 44ms. If you don't know what input lag is, that is the half second delay when you're playing a first person shooter when you move your character. Input lag throws your game off and literally makes you worse than you really are ha-ha. For those wanting to know how to put it on PC mode, all you have to do is switch the input to the HDMI port you plugged your console in and when you select it you have to click tools on your remote. When you click tools on your remote, click edit name and then you should see where it says "PC." Click on that and BOOM, no more input lag and your video games run flawlessly. You really only need to do this if you're playing first person shooters though because you can't tell the difference on any other game really unless you're a gamer who has never seen sunlight.I did a lot of research on this TV, so I tried including everything I was concerned about to assist others in making their purchase. To be honest, this is a great TV in my opinion. It is an affordable price, and the picture is beautiful!P.S.  For those of you who are looking to mount this TV as well, the VESA on the back is 200 x 200. It was very difficult for me to find that online so I hope I helped you out :)

Reviews.Title: No Buyers Remorse!!!
Reviews.Author: Jim Frye
Reviews.Content: I love it!  The delivery company delivered and set my 55H6350 this morning.  What an amazing picture.  I couldnt be more happy with the picture quality.  I have read reviews about people who diss this tv because of the Slow Apps or Poor Sounds.  In my experience so far, the apps and web browser ARE slow but I have this TV connected to an Asus Chromebox and use that for web browsing and all apps.  So the smart features wont be used by me.  The built-in speakers sound okay to me.  Nothing spectacular but nothing horrible, just average.  However, I am using the Optical Out from the TV to my A/V Receiver and all is well.I found the following calibration online and seem to really enhance the picture to provide true colors.Picture Mode  MovieBacklight  15  <---- increase if in a bright roomContrast  95Brightness  46Sharpness  14Color  50Tint  G50/R50Advance SettingsDynamic Contrast  OffBlack Tone  OffFlesh Tone  0RGB Only Mode  OffColor Space  Auto10pt White Balance  OnGamma  +1Expert Pattern  OffxvYCC  OffPicture OptionsColor Tone  Warm2Digital Noise Filter  OffMPEG Noise Filter  OffHDMI Black Level  Normal (Low if available)Film Mode  OffAuto Motion Plus  Off10pt White Balance  ONPicture Size  Screen FitSo after 4 hours, I would recommend this tv to Anyone.  I'll report back if I have problems in the future but so far ZERO buyers remorse.UPDATE:  30 days in and I could not be more happy with my purchase.  I did a ton of comparison (probably too much) shopping before buying this tv.  Boy did I make the right decision. This TV is SWEET!  again, i dont use the smart features so no comment on them.

Reviews.Title: Major improvement
Reviews.Author: W. Farr
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Samsung to replace a 5 year old Sony led tv that had developed screen problems. The difference between the picture quality of this Samsung and the Sony is shocking. The Samsung is sharper with far more color range and depth. Black levels are excellent and this from a tv that weighs far less than the Sony. You don't get an owners manual with this tv to describe all the functions and controls so you will need to set up internet access to use the e-manual or to download it to your computer. Connecting to your wi fi is easy but to be honest I cant seem to access any of the apps such as Netflix or Vudu and I don't have a wireless keyboard to evaluate surfing the web. The tuner in this tv is also receives roughly 20 more stations off the air than the Sony did. I cant say if the 5 year difference in the TV's is why it is so much better or if it is some Samsung "magic"...I can just tell you that you wont regret buying this tv!

Reviews.Title: Best TV Ever!
Reviews.Author: Gerald R. Forcier
Reviews.Content: I just received this TV yesterday and it is the most beautiful television I've ever owned.  The picture is so unbelievably crisp and clear, you feel like people are in the room with you.  Even in bright sunlight, the picture stands out.  This is the best purchase I have had in decades!

Reviews.Title: Very happy.
Reviews.Author: Josh S.
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a 32" Panasonic IPS-panel LCD TV to this model and I'm very pleased with it so far. For this price-range, I have no complaints and think 5 stars is very fair. That being said, there are some nit-picky flaws which I've made note of.Pros:- Smart features are great.- Has a beautiful picture.- 120 Hz is awesome!- 0.3" bezel makes the TV itself looks great.- Blacks are, indeed, very black (sometimes it looks as if the whole TV shuts off when it goes to a black screen).- Plenty of inputs.- Easy to set up.- Network features are nice.- Great price.- Games, DVDs, and Blu-Rays all look fantastic.- Semi-matte screen is a nice touch (especially if you have a bright room with windows).Cons:- Viewing angle isn't a perfect 180 degrees. You'll notice some (MINOR) loss of quality if you are sitting to the left or the right of the TV. That being said, I watch it from the front and the right side and it's not enough of a big deal (or noticeable) to take away a star.- Note: Unless you plan on spending thousands on your TV, most LED TVs have this issue. There is a very, very slight "blotchiness" in the screen. I only notice it when the screen fades to completely white (otherwise you honestly can't tell) and really, it's hardly noticeable in the first place and again, not worth taking away a star.  The reason why this happens (or so I've read) is because the TV is so thin, the actual LEDs are pushing against the panel, causing the effect.Overall, I'm very happy with this TV and I highly recommend it. The problems I mentioned were so trivial that you might not even notice them, but I felt that they were worth mentioning, anyway.If you want to save some money and settle for a little less, this was my second choice of TV as it's similar in design and assortment of features, http://www.amazon.com/Sony-KDL48W600B-48-Inch-1080p-60Hz/dp/B00HPMCNXIOther than that, I don't really know if it's actually any good.If something comes up to change my mind about anything, I'll be editing this review.

Reviews.Title: Samsung H6350 VS Vizio M-Series
Reviews.Author: JB
Reviews.Content: I left this in the question section and wanted to add it to both TV reviews for everyone to see.I just purchased the Vizio M401i and it was delivered 3 days ago, it's already going back in the box and being sent back. None of the VIA apps that stream from the net worked even when I am connected to my wireless network and using the test function for net getting 15MB down to the TV, but I know for a fact that it was able to connect to their server and download the firmware for the device. I called Vizio support on this and the technician was reading from a script and had no insight on actually how to fix the problem other than to do a full reset then refer it to the second level technicians. LOL everything with their support was a joke, I spent over an hour on the phone to no avail, and I'm very tech savvy so it was a complete waste of time. The Vizio also will not connect correctly to the ZYXEL NAS320 that I have on my network hosting media content with movies, pictures, and music. It will not recognize any content on the device even though it sees it on my network and does not support common file extensions like MKV, MWA, or AVI. I did extensive research only to realize that I would have to run all my content through a converter and make them MPEG4 before this would stream them across the network.I will admit the picture on this TV was good and I'm doing OTA tv and that was fine. The main reason I bought it was to get Amazon Prime content in the bedroom and to access my NAS for movies, neither of which the Vizio will do. I have a Samsung D8000 series in the living room so I have a good comparison source which will do everything I have mentioned above and more, only the 2011 models don't have the Amazon app. This one is going back and I will be purchasing this Samsung. The Vizio will save you a little money but for me $140 just isn't worth the extra aggravation that I've had to put up with. You get what you pay for and this is another example of that. As  soon as I get the refund for the Vizio I will be having this one sent to me.Update: Return complete on the Vizio and I have purchased the Samsung H6350 and had a couple days to work with it. It's like getting out of a Ford Fiesta and getting into a GT500 Mustang. (That's for all you guys out there ;-P) Picture is in my estimate is 20% better so even though the Vizio has a very good picture this one is better, very feature rich including Channel Guide that even works with OTA reception and Set Top Box controls plus full network support for connecting to my NAS and other DLNA compatible devices. Network is fast and reliable as well, streamed BluRay movie from both the NAS and Amazon Prime without any hiccups and flawless picture, sound is slightly lower but I don't really expect perfection from 2@10W speakers just turn it up 4 or 5 more and it's very adequate.Did have one issue that came up but it wasn't a major problem, network was found but wouldn't join I'm assuming because of the drivers of the wireless card. I run a WPA2 network with AES encryption and ended up putting the password 6 or 7 times trying to get it to join to no avail. I went to the router and turned on my guest network with no encryption, hopped on it and updated the firmware then no more problem got connected to the secured network first time. The onscreen keyboard is a qwerty keyboard and navigation is somewhat cumbersome but expected since the remote doesn't have a full keyboard like my F8000 Samsung does.In conclusion you get what you pay for, the Samsung was about $150 more than the Vizio but well worth the money in my opinion. I'm a techie and worked in the computer field for over 15 years so I am very particular about my electronics and computers. I was trying to save a few dollars by purchasing the Vizio and while it is fine for doing just the bare minimum for TV and has some Smart features there is no comparison to a quality Samsung product. I bought the M-Series because it was supposed to be the most feature rich between it and the E-Series only to be disappointed in overall performance and functionality. Samsung has more than met my expectations of a Smart TV and what it's capable of as far as the bells and whistles was a nice bonus.

Reviews.Title: Great TV Great Picture Great Price
Reviews.Author: F.C.N.Y.
Reviews.Content: For a couple weeks I was trying to decide whether to buy this new model the UN48H6350 or the pricier one above it, the UN48H6400, I compared specs, there weren't many reviews for either TV, since both are new 2014 models, but since the UNH6350 line is supposed to be Samsungs "budget" line of smart TVs I compared and decided that it was not worth paying an extra $300 for the UNH6400,I didn't need 3D or a fancy remote or the "Micro Dimming" (software to improve black level) that the UNH6350 lacked.I decided on and purchased the UN48H6350, it was delivered fast, Amazon shipped it via UPS but I'm sure had the tv been the 50" or above models they would have used their good big ticket item delivery services.I've had the TV a couple weeks now and couldn't be happier...the 48" size is perfect, the screen and very thin bezel look classy, but most of all, the picture is absolutely fantastic with great black levels and soo sharp that regular HD looks almost like 3D but without needing glasses and the screens anti-reflection ability is great too. The Smart TV features and apps are very good, the integrated wifi is also very good.I noticed that the price had falled a week after I bought it, I submitted the price match request and Amazon came through and was great, refunded the difference withing 24-48hours.My suggestion, if you are also debating purchasing between the UNH6350 and UNH6400 and you don't need or want 3D or a voice activated remote (that the UNH6400 has) and want to save some money...This is the model to get...hands down...it has everything else, along with a good price.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, Netflix & other apps don't work, stand is garish...
Reviews.Author: Susie
Reviews.Content: We just received this TV on April 4th. My initial reaction was flimsy packaging, lightweight TV and all plastic (including the stand) construction. The chrome finish stand is horrible. It and the small chrome band running along the bottom of the TV is reflective and totally distracts your eye when viewing a program. This is especially true in the dark as it reflects the light from the screen.  Connections are simple enough and setup was straightforward. There is no paper manual and the e-manual on the screen is awkward because you can't simultaneously read it's instructions AND make the necessary adjustments in the on-screen menus. Also, the "eco sensor" keeps dimming the picture and then it will spontaneously snap back to bright again. This is very annoying but the feature can be turned off (if you can find the menu option to do so-it's in a drop down submenu offscreen).  However, my major disappointment was the smart hub. Not one single app worked! Every app was grayed out and when you tried to select one it simply responded by saying "This function is not supported". I can use the browser so I know that my internet connection is sound. It's definitely a firmware/software issue. After 5 hours of setting/resetting every possible variable the Samsung techs finally concluded that a service tech needs to come to my house and investigate the problem hands on. They then told me that I had only 1 month left on my warranty. When I told them that I just bought the TV today they insisted that I needed to send them a photo of my receipt to prove it before they would extend it until April 2015. This despite the fact that my serial number told them that it was just manufactured in March 2014!  I had sworn off ever purchasing a Samsung TV again after buying a Netflix ready set back in 2009 only to find that Samsung did not acquire the necessary licenses from Netflix and so that app never worked for the life of the TV (which subsequently died just out of warranty and would have cost more to repair than to buy a new one). Now I'm afraid that I am in a similar boat with this TV so I will more than likely be returning it for a full refund. If you are buying this TV for the Smart features (Netflix, Pandora, Hulu, etc.)I'd wait to see if they can get them to work properly and consistently. As for the stand I guess you could always sand it and paint it black but that seems to be a little extreme for a brand new TV.

Reviews.Title: Froze during initial setup, turns off and on...
Reviews.Author: Pak-Man
Reviews.Content: This review is for the Samsung UN32H6350 32-inch 1080p 120Hz Smart LED TVAesthetically, this television is beautiful. The moment I turned it on, I was fascinated by the vivid colors. Too bad I couldn't get through the initial setup phase...During the initial setup of the TV, I was being guided through the steps. At step 7, the TV asks you for your zip code to identify local service providers. I tried to input the zip code, but the TV was not responding to the remote control. Moreover, I started noticing the TV was turning off and on by itself. I saw the TV was frozen at step 7, with a two arrow icon moving circularly. I tried turning off the TV, disconnecting the cable from the wall, then turning on again, but the TV image returned to step 7 with the loading icon still there, frozen.I called Samsung's customer service and a representative simply suggested that I return the product, or get it exchanged. The representative informed me that recently hundreds, or thousands of callers had the same issues with this model. He mentioned that Samsung should be recalling the TV's because of these consistent defects.This was my first Samsung TV that I was really looking forward to, and it sucks that my first impression left me rather disappointed. I hope this review can help fellow shoppers. Right now, as of May and June 2014, their newer models might have defects, so BEWARE.

Reviews.Title: Perfect tv for an apt
Reviews.Author: Rushabh Sheth
Reviews.Content: I just set up my 48" yesterday and so far so ive had no problems with any features.I was hesitant on purchasing this tv when i read the reviews and it said the apps didnt work. But when i set it up, the apps work great, even the netflix works great.The tv was very easy to hook up and set up and everything is working great.Only downside is that the apps load a little slow (but i cant say i have any other tv to compare it to),The user interface is very easy to get the hang of.I use a wireless mouse and keyboard to do the web browsing and all of that because its much easier to use than the samsung remote.My parents are tech-impaired but they both enjoy the new tv and find it easy to use (the apps still need some training to get used to for them).I love the design of the tv and how slim it is, and i use the stand and it looks great and seems very sturdy.The picture is solid, and i am waiting to hook up my new samsung HW-F450 sound bar but besides that the sound from the tv sounds fine (nothing spectacular but equal to any other led tv).I have yet to watch a basketball game on it but ESPN and all the sports channels look amazing.Bottom line is that for the price its gold. and if you are hesitant to buy this tv because of the apps not working, dont worry, the apps work great and i have not had any problems using them and setting them up.

Reviews.Title: Cheap chinese panel!
Reviews.Author: Dawn B. Roy
Reviews.Content: Beware of all Samsung LED LCD sets. They outsource most of the panels to three companies: AU optronics, Chi Mei optoelectronics and sharp.  They are all inferior to Samsung Panels with Sharp being the next best, AU third and Chi Mei last.  Samsung only ships sets to raters and shows with the Samsung panels inside. What does that tell you.  I saw this set at BB and it looked fantastic. Bought it on Amazon and it was delivered two days later. Amazon rocks by the way!. Set it up and calibrated it. Blacks looked poor and the contrast was poor.  Off axis viewing was poor. Picture grainy and I have the sharpness down to 0.  Called Samsung and of course they said this was not a service issue but would forward my complaint to the important people.  Amazon cannot search their warehouse for the version to replace this set with a real Samsung TV.  On the sticker on the box and behind the set, there is a version number. If it starts with a T then you win the Samsung Panel Lottery. If it does not you lose!  Here is a link to the info:[...].  Buy local so you can check this number.

Reviews.Title: Great televisioin
Reviews.Author: Safari
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace an old set. I was pleased with the picture until I got an HDMI cable and was astounded by the clarity and crispness of the screen. Smart features that make this an incredible addition to our family room. Internet surfing, movie rentals, it does it all. Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Remote broke, power cycling problem, appalling customer service
Reviews.Author: ProfAvenarius
Reviews.Content: We bought a new Samsung 55 in LED TV in Dec 2013.By Feb 2014, the remote control stopped working.  We called Samsung Customer Service and they sent us a new one for free.  So far, so good, but it would have been nicer to have a remote that didn't break in the first place.In Mar 2014 the TV developed an irregular power cycling problem, typically when we used online applications like Netflix, but also when watching cable.  It would cycle a few times a day and the go a week without failure, and then start power cycling again.  By April 2014, it became so severe that rendered the TV unwatchable.  That's where the real fun began.We called Samsung Customer Support.  They ran us through the rigmarole of trouble shooting: check the firmware version, check the power connection, watch the power indicator flash, etc.  Unable to recreate the problem in the span of a 5 min call, the representative declared the TV in fine working order and threw me off the line.  Naturally, the TV entered a power cycling frenzy immediately after the call.  I tried Samsung's online chat function.  We repeated the troubleshooting process.  This time the representative declared the TV defective and suggested a repair under warranty.  Wouldn't I please fill out the online service request referencing the trouble ticket number?  Certainly - but alas the website wouldn't record my data.  Tried again.  Still wouldn't record my data.  Called Samsung again, referenced my trouble ticket number.  The representative insisted on repeating the troubleshooting process for a third time.  I complied, but the TV interrupted troubleshooting by power cycling in the middle of it.  Would I please restart the process again? No, I would not.  Representative insisted we inanely repeat trouble shooting indefinitely.  I refused.  Representative put me on hold to 'talk to a manager', returned and insisted on continuing with the troubleshooting.  I refused and asked to speak to the 'manager' myself.  The 'manager' was not available to speak to me.  This exchange fecklessly repeated several times until some unkind criticism compelled the representative to agree to schedule a repair ten days in the future.  Great, no TV for ten days.The vendor agreed to take it back and I'm therefore returning this heap of trash and replacing it with something that's not a Samsung.  Spending a few extra dollars on a Sony is worth it.

Reviews.Title: new firmware bug (ver.1109.3) Please read this carefully!!!
Reviews.Author: Daniela Ricci
Reviews.Content: I got this tv three weeks ago, everything was fine until I updated to the new firmware ver.1109.3. After this I decided to edit the channel list to hide all the no HD channels. That was it! TV started cycling on and off. So I got a new one, and I tried again to edit the channel list, and again that was it! power cycling on and off. Now according to Samsung's support the only way to repair this is to change the mother board!!!!! Seriously???? Really Samsung??? Not even a RESET procedure????So disappointed.I'm waiting now for a technician to come to repair my tv....

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Bri
Reviews.Content: We owned a Vizio smart tv for 3 years and it already died. It no longer turned on. The tv had problems from the get go so it doesn't surprise me. We decided to buy a samsung as a higher quality tv and so far so good! Amazing quality and the app screen is so awesome. Not a little bar down at he bottom like the Vizio, it's actually a whole screen that shows them all. We've got hulu on it and daily burn for workouts. Now my parents are even thinking of getting one. And it's been great for gaming as we'll.

Reviews.Title: Happy so far
Reviews.Author: Wickerman1972
Reviews.Content: First of all I want to comment about how pleased I am with how quickly Amazon got this to me. I ordered it just yesterday and despite having chosen regular free shipping I have it today for whatever reason.I've messed with it just a few hours and so far I am very satisfied with it. I've played some Xbox 360 games and also watched some HD movies on the 360's HD-DVD add-on and everything looks quite nice. I had feared that I wouldn't be satisfied with the black levels and for months I had considered purchasing the $1,800 Samsung 46F8000 because of that concern. That model has micro-dimming at the hardware level and according to CNET the blacks are exceptional for a LED HDTV because of it. Because $1,800 is a hefty price for a 46" TV I waited months for a good sale on that model but it just never happened. In the end I decided that $1,800 was too much to pay and went with this one instead. No, the blacks on this model are not a perfect inky black but really no LCD/LED HDTV I've seen so far does black perfectly. But the blacks are pretty good for a $850 edge-lit TV (Edit: Turns out this set is back-lit. Amazon says it's edge-lit but CNET says it's back-lit. Considering the thickness of it and the tiny bezel around the screen I think CNET is correct), better than I was expecting in fact.

Reviews.Title: Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is so great there are times when I think I have actually falling into the TV only to find out I’m just motor boating a screen.  Want to stream Turn Down for What on youtube to your TV to set the mood?  Consider it done.  You wont be disappointed…until you realize that Kat Dennings isn’t actually in your living rooms wearing that outfit.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant Picture and a Wealth of Features Complement Good Design
Reviews.Author: Ray B.
Reviews.Content: Even out of the box, the picture of this set is great but a bit of tweaking and calibration makes it even better. I was surprised to see that even with my good eyes I was only able to make out very slight screen disuniformity in bright scenes. Every LCD has imperfect screen uniformity, but this one's a cut above. Color accuracy is nearly perfect and contrast is handled extremely well. The best way for a layman to measure contrast is to compare off pixels to the bezel when there's a dark scene on. Older flat panels using CCFL backlights could never produce "true" blacks as there was always a faint glow from off pixels. This is still true for LED backlit models like this, but to a much lesser extent. This set can produce pixels nearly as black as the bezel to where it can be difficult to tell where the screen ends and where the bezel begins. Not a perfect black like an OLED, but close. Well done Samsung.Some have complained about the sound being flat, which was confusing because last year's similar model was touted as having above average sound for an LCD even though both models have 10w speakers that are down firing. Judging by photos, the H63xx has an even larger speaker housing. Now that I've heard it, I can say the sound is a little flat depending on the source. Other times it sounds great. It turns out there is an equalizer with five(!) tuning meters, which I assume represent low bass to high treble. Seems the presets aren't properly calibrated, which isn't suprising. I would recommend you play around with the equalizer depending on the source. Should get it sounding great. Of course, if you're using external speakers, none of this will matter.The Smart features are suprisingly well implemented. Apps respond quick thanks to a quad-core processor, setup was easy enough, and the Smart Hub interface is easy to navigate. A far cry from Smart TV early days where slow and clunky was the norm. I'm trying to think of a complaint as I type, but I can't find one. TuneIn can sometimes be slow to load station lists. That's all I got.It has a very thin bezel, less than a half inch. As for the stand, it's design is subjective. I think it looks nice, but I know for some people the chrome finish might be distracting and the quad leg design might seem odd. It is a bit wider than the traditional sqaure stand, so you might need to make some room if you're not wall mounting.For gamers, enabling game mode will reduce input lag to a tiny 30 ms. Yet another great aspect in addition to 4 HDMI ports one of which is ARC capable and three USB ports (Do I really need three? lol) Overall, I'm very impressed with this set; the quality engineering really shows.

Reviews.Title: UPDATED. My parents are intimidated by technology, but they quickly got the hang of this.
Reviews.Author: Bmommy
Reviews.Content: My family and I have had excellent experiences with everything Samsung, so narrowing down our choices to just Samsung was a no-brainer.  I'm not a tech expert but I did consult with my tech guru friends, who gave me great advice on what to look for.  They said to make sure it was 1080p and 120Hz for a better picture, among other suggestions.  I tend to research major purchases to death, and I was very pleased with the consumer evaluations and reports, showing this to be reliable and user-friendly, with an excellent picture.My parents are thrilled with the size, quality, and high performance of this Samsung, and my kids love it so much that they started a Samsung fund for our own next TV purchase.  Highly recommend it.UPDATE:  I'd like to add a few more details, since I've had more experience testing out the new TV.  The setup was very user-friendly, and the overall use is very intuitive and easy to manage.  My parents are older, so they are very intimidated by technology, but this was easy for them to get the hang of, and now they absolutely love it.The picture on this TV is something beautiful to behold.  We have gotten used to HD, but this is on another level.  Positively brilliant images, smooth moving, and almost an artistic experience in itself.  Who knew watching TV could be so breathtaking?My parents love to watch travel shows, and we frequently join them, talking about where we've been and where we'd like to go.  Seeing the incredible images of scenic destinations makes it almost seem like you are right there viewing it first-hand.  We are just thrilled with the picture quality on this Samsung, and very happy with our choice.  Hope this review helps someone.  Thank you for reading.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful, works perfect, love SmartTV feature
Reviews.Author: John P. Williams
Reviews.Content: I've had it one week, and so far its amazing. The picture is incredible, and the SmartTV functions are great. I am not good with tech stuff, but I've had no problem getting Amazon Prime, Bravo, and a couple other "Apps" working on the computer. The only ones that have given me trouble are Pandora and Spotify.My only compliant is minor - it takes a couple seconds to turn on. Maybe all new large tvs are like that?? It just takes some getting used to because I have to be patient and not hit the Power Button a second time, or else it turns off, and I have to restart the process.Otherwise, the tv is great. I highly recommend. Very thin, great sound, great picture, etc.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Keith C Patterson
Reviews.Content: Picture is great. No complaints about this tv. I did have to disable the auto-picture brightness control. It senses the light in the room with the TV and adjusts the screen brightness accordingly. I like my picture brighter than what it would adjust it too but once I figured that out I have been incredibly happy with the TV.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Ren
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is amazing. Sound quality is fantastic. All the smart features work well. Intensely fast Quad Core. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware - Samsung released these TVs to distributors before they were ready
Reviews.Author: EG
Reviews.Content: We were also victims to the power cycling issue that was caused by a glitch activated when you delete channels from the guide.... Sadly, we were on our second delivery of this television when we discovered this is what caused the power cycling. Taking a leap of faith, and relying on our brand loyalty with Samsung - we decided to try a third television. Unfortunately, I did not even get the chance to use the channel guide at all because it started power cycling during set up.This time, when we called Samsung, they told me that the issue was ****this model of television was not supposed to be released form their warehouse to distributors yet**** and that they only method they have to fix it is to arrange for a technician to come out. After speaking with the technician they contracted, we learned this brand new tv would require new parts and motherboard, and the tech agreed that for a brand new TV, we would be better off returning it. We already had concerns about opening the back of a brand new TV, and this confirmed our decision to FINALLY pick a new model. It will not be a Samsung, which is disappointing.For our trouble, we got a $7 credit with Amazon, and nothing from Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Display + Amazon Tech Support Excellent
Reviews.Author: Joseph
Reviews.Content: This replaced an 17-year-old behemoth 27" Magnavox that was on life support.  We are kind of overwhelmed by all the bells and whistles, but we really love the picture.  It was real easy to add to my Wi-Fi network.  Both of my computers had already connected with it, once I granted it access to my LinkSys router.  I am looking forward to exploring the internet feature.Amazon provides 30-day support for this particular purchase.  I have to say that it is fantastic.  The person I spoke to was very helpful and very courteous with setting it up and operating the features.  I definitely will consider this perk with my next purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, horrible support from samsung, apps useless
Reviews.Author: Yrofthetiger "Jennifer E."
Reviews.Content: Sadly, the apps do NOT work with this tv and I'm tired of calling Samsuck support and having them tell me it was released to sell before the "final update."  Well, Amazon and Samsuck, your 'final update' is being returned.  I'm tired of having to call all of the time to get support because the AP app randomly stopped working, or why the Amazon feed is so jerky (like it's seeking the internet connection and not pre-loading the show.  It shouldn't do this as I have blazing internet speed AND am hardwired in AND it doesn't do this when I use the AP app through the SONY blu ray player)!Otherwise, I loved the picture on this tv and the remote was so easy to set up!  It found all my devices right away and self programmed the remote.  I am a tech idiot and even I was able to set it up without having a coronary.  The picture is nice and bright and it has a very slim profile.  If I trusted that the app would actually work I would have kept the TV.Overall, I don't think the TV is worth the price because a `dumb' tv of the same quality costs about 300 less.  Why pay for app and support that don't work when you can just use a bluray player that has the apps already??

Reviews.Title: Picture flickers and quality declines immediatelyl
Reviews.Author: SJD "SJD"
Reviews.Content: I was excited to purchase a Samsung tv for under 2000, but this one wasn't worth a penny. The picture was initially very good, but after about three months the screen would go black but the sound stayed on. I looked online and I see that many other people are having the same issue. Samsung said to "replace  the lamp". Well, after expensive repairs it worked well for another two months and then went black again. I am extremely disappointed with Samsung's quality and customer service. When you purchase a high ticket item it should have a few years of life in it (at least!).I would be very leery about buying another Samsung at this juncture.

Reviews.Title: DOA: can't use it for more than 3 minutes
Reviews.Author: J. Andrews
Reviews.Content: From the first moment I turned on the TV (after setup) the unit continually power-cycled every 2-5 minutes. I contacted Samsung support who walked me through resetting the TV, attempting to check for software updates. After many failed attempts I could finally see there are no updates available (v 1005).Returned the unit and seriously considering a different brand as a replacement.

Reviews.Title: Maybe it's just my tv
Reviews.Author: Edwin D. Hill
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv almost a month ago and have been evaluating it since it arrived.  I use an antenna and was very pleasantly surprised when I set up the 6350.  The tuner in this thing is fantastic.  We eliminated the cable about 7 months ago, put an antenna in the attic, (don't have to deal with weather conditions that way).  With our old tv, a 10 year old Panasonic, we had to use a set top box to convert the antenna signals for the tv.  It was a good setup, but nothing compared to what happened with this new Samsung.  The old tv would get about 62 over the air channels, the 6350 pulled in 85.  Not just more channels, but the quality was much, much better.  I think Samsung has done a fantastic job on this tuner.  After editing out channels, home shopping club, QVC, etc, we kept about 45 of the channels, and they are all perfectly reliable.  The next thing I tried was the browser.  It works, although somewhat slow, but it did everything I wanted it to do.  It's not a desktop or laptop, so don't expect a lot as far as speed goes.  We also hooked up a Logitech wireless keyboard and mouse through the usb.  That helped a lot, don't even think about trying to use the remote on the browser, it is extremely frustrating.  Hooking up to my network was somewhat of a chore.  Finally got that to work, so I can use the picture, music, and movie files on the network.  That works good, once you figure out how to configure the network devices.  That was the most frustrating thing with this whole setup.  It's not the tv, it was figuring out all the sharing settings and permissions on the computers I was trying to share.  Yikes, I threw my hands up many times trying to get that to work.  The only two things that I found to be problems that are related to Samsung are the speakers and customer service.  The speakers are really poor.  I finally purchased a Samsung soundbar, HW-FM45C with wireless woofer.  That matched up perfectly and really improved the sounds.  Hooking that up was somewhat of confusing, it should have been very simple, but for some reason I had problems getting the correct cabling in order to use the tv remote for all the controls.  Works now though, great.  Customer Service is the only thing that I couldn't work around.  If you have simple questions, their book gives simple answers, but throw in a couple technical terms and you loose them on the first try.  I called asking questions about the codecs that the tv will recognize and they couldn't get past what input I was using, hdmi or usb.  When I tried to explain to them that I was on Ethernet their answer was, "That's not Possible".  So after a couple frustrating hours I decided to find out for myself what I needed to know.  Only took about a half hour to do myself.  So, final summary, we really enjoy the tv, for now it's the best for the price.  You can spend a whole lot more money and maybe get more gadgets, or spend less and use the savings to purchase a dedicated computer to hook-up to the tv. The only other thing I noticed was the apps that are available.  Maybe I was doing something wrong, but I couldn't go to google play and get any apps that would work on this tv.  It is loaded with a lot of apps from Samsung, and they are all free.  Just that there are a couple apps that I would like to have that I couldn't get.  I'll keep looking into this and if I come to a good or bad conclusion, i'll update this review.  This is an update::  To me, the web browser is just about useless.  I think Samsung is trying to reinvent the term ssss llll oooo wwww.  It does work, but 15 minutes to load google play??  I finally quit before it finished.  A hdmi cord and a laptop might help.  Update again.  5/30/14.  The tv started turning off intermittently and then turn right back on, all by itself.  It goes completely powered off and then clicks right back on.  Has happened to me 4 times in the past two weeks.  I spent 2 1/2 hours on the phone with Samsung customer service, impossible to get thru to them the problem, their final solution, unplug the Ethernet cable and try it for a couple weeks.  This is a smart tv, unplugging the internet is like removing its brain.  Why in the world would you want to have a smart tv and then remove the smart functions?  As a result of this I have lowered my star rating, even though it is a decent tv, I can't justify anything higher than a two due to the support from Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Buying through Amazon is the only way to go.
Reviews.Author: J. Rideout "Following Christ"
Reviews.Content: My 65-inch 1080p Smart LED tv was shipped within a week from ordering. After installing it on my wall, following all the instructions, I turned it on only to find out it did not work! But knowing Amazon from prior purchases, I was not worried. After calling Samsung and describing what was going on, it was determined that something happened somewhere in the handling of the TV and that something inside was broken. I contacted Amazon who immediately sent out another 65-inch 1080p Smart LED TV and told me that the delivery man would pick up the broken one. Within a week the delivery of the new one was made, the delivery guy helped me un-pack and mount it on the wall fixture. He also waited until I made sure it worked and packed up the broken tv, filled out paperwork and loaded the broken tv in his truck all in a matter of no more that 1/2 hour. There was no extra cost of shipping or any other charges. The TV works wonderful and we are very pleased with it. Dealing with other than Amazon would have been a nightmare as you could not return it to a store, you would have to make arrangements with Samsung themselves. Amazon made it a smooth process with no stress on the customer (me). I would encourage anyone to do business through Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Our Best TV ever
Reviews.Author: Randy Pitts
Reviews.Content: We were a little concerned about apps and internet connection in this TV working, but everything has worked perfectly so far.  The picture is so good it almost look like it's 3d at times.  Objects in the foreground almost look like they are sitting in the air in front of the screen.  I had the TV setup in about 10 minutes.  The wireless was up in another 5 minutes, and netflix and Amazon prime took another 5 minutes.  I'm seriously considering getting one for the bedroom!

Reviews.Title: SET DIDN'T WORK OUT OF THE BOX--picture fails to impress
Reviews.Author: poopazoo
Reviews.Content: I may update this after the set is repaired, but the set cycles off & on every few minutes--looked like some other people had the same problem.  It's very frustrating when you see the fed ex truck pull up, get excited to check out the new tv & having to call Samsung-- then stuck waiting until the repair man shows up.  I will say the Samsung person I talked to seemed nice & was helpful.So far the picture I am getting is questionable.  I think I had a better picture from the Vizio that the Samsung is replacing, but with the power cycling off, I haven't been able to play around with the settings much.  I will say the default visual settings are not impressive to me at all.  We were all blown away when we first got the Vizio. With our first Samsung--not so much.One other problem, which I didn't notice when purchasing is the lack of rca audio out connections.  (There are zero).  I guess I need to upgrade my speaker system & I should have noticed from the description, but it's a little disappointing to have to retire a component that still works perfectly fine..

Reviews.Title: Does what I bought it to do
Reviews.Author: T. Wylie
Reviews.Content: Bought it to drive from my computer, didn't need the smart features so I don't use them.  The biggest surprise has been the start-up time as it comes on faster than any of the other TV models I'd turned on before.  Almost instant.  I use it to play movies and game a bit.  It works just like a monitor.It took me awhile to figure out that the circle that flashes up during start-up is a temperature guage, I'm not sure what the complete range is but I did notice 80 degrees is in the 'red'.  Will be interesting to see how it performs during the summer when my house temperature climbs into the mid-80's.I'm sure someone will experience a similar issue so I'll mention it;  I originally set the TV up to use with my newer MacBook Pro.  There was some glitchiness and screen ghosting/artifacts that I didn't care for, in theory the video card should have been able to handle the resolution but in reality it couldn't.  Hooking it up to my old 2009 Mac Pro with an upgraded HD5770 video card did the trick.  TV is crystal clear with no issues.

Reviews.Title: Not a terrible TV, but know it's limitations before buying
Reviews.Author: Jake
Reviews.Content: First experience with Samsung having always purchased Panasonic plasmas in the past.  The picture is OK after properly setting up the unit (noise filters must be on to get any decent image).  By no means is it as good as our other plasmas but those are higher end TV's bought for a different purpose.  The viewing angle on this is really poor.  I could not recommend it for anything other than straight on viewing.  Connectivity is very good with several I/O options on the back.  Aesthetically a nice looking TV as well.  No, the speakers on the TV aren't the best but they are serviceable.  There is the ability to define a wall vs. stand mounted configuration for the audio and that does help.  You should really be driving a soundbar or other external audio setup anyway so it shouldn't be an issue but the TV speakers can be used for casual viewing.The real problem with this set is the smart TV feature.  It isn't just that the interface is clumsy and monotonous to navigate (which it is).  The kicker is the anemic content options and nearly useless web browsing feature.  Perhaps most frustrating.(and why we returned the TV), is Samsung's policy related to 3rd party apps.  One of the primary reasons we bought this TV was for it's Pandora compatibility. After 2 weeks of streaming Pandora through the app on the TV, it just disappeared.  Contacted Samsung only to be told that SAMSUNG HAS DISABLED THE FEATURE!!  At first the Pandora icon was removed entirely, now it's present but you cannot use it (error message displays).  The Samsung customer service rep said they were aware of the issue and that it impacts the following models: H5500, H6300, H6350, H6400, H7100 and H7150.  They were 'working' through it with Pandora and cited a "content partner certification" issue.  It was working fine, they turned it off for bureaucratic reasons and are in no rush to fix it.  There's no technical problem, just their "policy".Best advice I can give you is to not lay the cash out for a Samsung Smart TV.  Stick with your Chromecast/Roku/Wii/Apple TV or any other 3rd party interface.  If Samsung is going to pull this kind of stuff, there's just no reliability in uninterrupted service for the content you may want.  We ended up returning the TV and bought another Apple TV box for a new Panasonic.  As a consumer there isn't too much more you can do to voice your displeasure with a manufacturer.  Too bad, was looking forward to our Samsung experience but can't endorse their products following this.

Reviews.Title: Great TV but tech issues
Reviews.Author: BGH
Reviews.Content: The TV was a great buy. I priced it at other stores and Amazon had it $100 cheaper. The picture quality is great. The sound could be better for the TV so a sound bar may be needed. The TV stand seems to may the TV sit on a slight tilt. I am also having a hard time getting my pioneer surround sound hooked up to the TV. It may be my error but my last TV was Samsung it worked with no problem.

Reviews.Title: greated
Reviews.Author: Ann A.
Reviews.Content: This had a great picture right out of the box. All the set ups were very easy. We added a Samsung sound bar and a blue ray player.I definitely recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Samsung=Quality
Reviews.Author: Jake
Reviews.Content: I've read all these reviews and was hesitant about buying it since more than a couple people said the apps don't work. Well, I haven't had the slightest problem with this TV. I now have a 22", 40" and 55" Samsung TV's and I don't think I'll ever own another brand.I do believe the apps are all functional now because of a software update that was required after connecting to WiFi. Either way, everything is working perfectly.You can't beat Samsung in quality TVs

Reviews.Title: Extremely satisfied
Reviews.Author: laureli
Reviews.Content: The picture quality exceeds expectations.  Fantastic to re-view movies with new, improved definition.  Smart TV access to Internet etc. is convenient, fun, and easy to use, even for a senior citizen.  Love the sixty inch screen.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, does almost everything well
Reviews.Author: peter Brown
Reviews.Content: TV provides excellent picture and wi-fi access.  Mounted mine to the wall, but low so is in line with seated eye position.  Did not make mistake many make of mounting high, like over fireplace.  Hate the viewing position that creates!TV easy to hook-up and program.Only complaint is built in speakers not wonderful but this is typical of flat panel TV's.  One key reason I bought this one is optical audio output which I use to drive a Polk Audion 5000 soundbar mounted (on brackets I made) directly under the TV.

Reviews.Title: bright, thin and sharp, ugly stand
Reviews.Author: John A. Turner
Reviews.Content: bright, thin, and sharp, but boy is the stand ugly - would greatly prefer simple black to the fake chrome

Reviews.Title: Great TV - if working properly
Reviews.Author: lisa stephenson
Reviews.Content: I'm having issues with the wireless, and support sucks to say the least. I first called Samsung about this issue a week and a half ago, and have endured 6 calls, most of which with people for whom English is not their first language so there was some difficulty communicating. After my patience ran out, I finally got escalated to what they call "Executive Support" (someone that sounded stateside and LISTENED) and have now got a day for a technician to come out. Hoping for the best...The picture is nice on the TV though.To describe my issue: My TV wireless adapter isn't seeing any wireless networks at all. When you go to network setup and select wireless, it searches then eventually gives up without an error message. I question whether this may be a firmware problem and not hardware, because it did detect wireless networks on a couple of occasions on earlier revisions. However, it has consistently been unable to detect wireless networks since I updated to version 1110.I have noticed on a few occasions while in setup that the screen would go black and the TV wouldn't respond to the remote for a couple of minutes. Patience or power cycling would lead to resolution. I did mention it to Samsung in a couple of my calls, but didn't force the issue because it was inconsistent. I'll figure this one out later, or hopefully it'll get resolved in another firmware update.***Update***Repair replaced main board Friday. It had other issues as well that were intermittent like lost picture a couple of times, and being nonresponsive to remote for minutes at a time (light would blink quick when you attempt). I had also noticed picture going darker randomly on occasion. The tech was swift in repair and seemed knowledgeable. It seems replacing the board has fixed everything. Will update again after some time has passed.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, great price
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is awesome as expected. Really the great thing about Samsung smart TVs is the Smart Hub feature. Easily linked it into my wireless internet and linked it with phones and a tablet. I also got Samsung's sound bar for added depth of sound.Also, plugged in thumb/flash drive loaded with music into the back USB port. I just leave it there and access the smart hub, select a music folder and have it shuffle through the songs, great for entertainment music.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: Arun M
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV two weeks back and really loving it. I didnt find any issues with this TV. Really good.

Reviews.Title: TV is great, but not the Smart apps
Reviews.Author: Tim162
Reviews.Content: Everything about the picture and sound quality is great.  However, the smart apps do not work so well and Netflix rarely ever works.  Pretty disappointing, as I have a 3 year old Samsung Blu-ray player and Netflix works fine on it.

Reviews.Title: Definitely worth it!
Reviews.Author: Costas Ioannides
Reviews.Content: I sent a few months deciding which unit to purchase, by the time I had decide on a Samsung LED unit I was torn between buying last year's and this year's model.  I am overly ecstatic with the choice I made.  The picture in HD is amazingly clear, and the audio is also much, much better than I expected.  The only drawback, if it could be called one, is the thinnest of the unit and the positioning and types of connections.  I attached this unit to a wall that already had a bracket in place, unfortunately there was not enough back clearance for the existing audio jack I had.  I just need to acquire a 90 degree jack to make it work.  Other than that one minor blip, I am completely satisfied with this unit!

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV
Reviews.Author: D.C.M.
Reviews.Content: Ok. I have been thrust into another century with this Smart TV!!! I absolutely LOVE it! Beautiful picture, sound, easy set up. Had my handyman wall mount. I think the only thing I would change is the backlighting on the remote….when you press that button, it's lit for too short a time. However, I'm sure I will have muscle memory soon of where the buttons are!! Love the Smart TV button with immediate connection to Netflix, Amazon Prime, Comedy Central etc!!! Seriously, if you're in the market, this is a great TV!

Reviews.Title: will not support Bluetooth audio output
Reviews.Author: Jr
Reviews.Content: While the TV it's self is very good it will not support Bluetooth output to headphones or external speakers while using apps by Netflix or Amazon to watch instant video. Both Samsung and Amazon say that they are working on the problem but may take months to resolve, meanwhile I can not use the headphones with the apps and that was a big part of why I bought the TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!!
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: This TV is great.  After reading mixed reviews about others problems I still took my chances.  First I'm a prime member and ordered about noon on a Tuesday, later in the day I received an email from UPS stating I would have it by the end of the day on Wednesday.  Arrived as stated, one day unbelievable.  I unpacked and connected, powered up and followed the prompts.  The internet connection was simple and the remote set up to control my cable box also went well.  The only complaint about the cable box/ remote is the info button does not give the programming/ channel info but flips over to previous channel.  Other than that, I cannot find any other complaints.  After set up I accessed the apps.  I logged into Netflix and Amazon prime with no problems and both run fine.  As for the backlighting issues, being too dark or light.  I adjusted the backlighting as it was a little dark for my taste in a dark room, but after that picture was great.  My wife wants to replace another TV in the house for another Samsung saying she can't believe the difference in the picture from the other TV's in the house..

Reviews.Title: Picture and function is excellent.
Reviews.Author: W. Miller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have had a 42' JVC for over 5 years now. We were ready to upgrade to the 50-55" range and started looking at different TVs. We compared the specs and learned a sufficient amount to not feel clueless.This TV, as opposed to the older 6300 from last year, has a quadcore processor. If you will be using the Smart functions or other options this is the reason for the price difference. We want this TV to last at least 5 years and so the extra power was worth the additional cost.The picture is crisp and the adjustments / presets are very functional. You should be mindful of lighting in your room as this TV is very reflective. It doesn't seem to have any glare reduction. Be aware that it might annoy you. Try to position the TV in the best location to avoid glare.Those are the simple positives. It's a competitive price. It has good upgrades and functionality. There is a remote included (at least mine had one) and there is also a small joystick on the lower right-hand corner. Click it in to access the menu without the remote. There is no voice (that I'm aware of), and it wasn't advertised to me as having voice. Purchased at Best Buy.My biggest complaint, and the reason for the lack of that fifth star is the sound.I have been trying to find a happy medium with the sound of the television with no avail. It seems echo prone and the sound is very flat. It has caused several ear aches thus far.This seems to be isolated to myself, and not the rest of the family so it is manageable. This may be caused by my tinnitus or other neurological problems. If you have some similar issue this might not be the television for you. It really affects my enjoyment of the television... which I am quite upset with. It really is a remarkably clear and refined picture compared to Vizio, LG and the like. Overall I would still recommend this television. The sound issue is not a deal breaker for me, we will be getting a sound bar / reciever to alleviate that issue later on.Extra Note: The four HDMI ports are essential as new media devices come out. With other comparable models only having 2 HDMI ports, maybe three; this TV has an added value. The four HDMI ports was influential in our choice on this TV.

Reviews.Title: The Samsung Link software will not work with 64 bit computers
Reviews.Author: Stephen Broumas
Reviews.Content: Picture quality and most features are very good but.........if you want to display video or pictures that reside on your PC or laptop on the TV via WIFI the best method is to download the SamsungLink software.  I downloaded the software then called tech support at Samsung when the SamsungLink software failed to run.  I was told that SamsungLink will not run on a 64 bit computer.Since 64 bit computers have been out for years now seems odd that Samsung has not upgraded this most important program.  Very disappointing and surprising!  Customer beware!!!!

Reviews.Title: Frustrated
Reviews.Author: Robyn
Reviews.Content: I ordered the first TV which arrived with a cracked frame and a shattered screen. Immediately initiated it's return and another one sent. All went smoothly and the Amazon service was great. The second TV arrived yesterday. No damage as far as the eye could see. Unfortunately after setting it up and plugging it in I had no picture and no sound. I have spent the entire morning online and on the phone with Samsung service. They are sending a repairman to fix the power module. I am more than a little frustrated. I am giving this product 2 stars only because the service from Amazon and Samsung has been very good. Will update if it EVER works

Reviews.Title: I read many of the reviews on this model(UN48H6350), and it seems many had problems mostly with the 'smart' end of it.
Reviews.Author: Denno
Reviews.Content: After going through my own setup experiences, I think the biggest problem is Samsung doesn't give much written info, but has you step through their process of how to set the unit into operation. After putting the stand assembly(which swivels)  on the TV unit and plugging in, they start a step process to get everything running. And one of the things that came up early was getting the remote working to control my receiver from Direct TV. I wasted a lot of time because the instructions just keep telling you to give it another try in order to get a response from the receiver. So I exited from that and proceeded to get the TV online where it was a 'dumb' TV basically. Then I tried with the apps for Netflix, Amazon and Mgo, which are the places where I might rent movies. All did good after I went through the sign-in. I stopped for that day, and resumed early the next day. As I powered up the TV, I received a message from Samsung that an update had been sent, and also from my DirectTV provider. I also noticed my cable box wouldn't transmit a 1080p resolution because I was using the component jacks instead. So after re-connecting to HDMI1, my picture came in like never before! And then re-tried the remote control on my DirectTV receiver, and now it worked just fine! I should comment about the sound, because my old HDTV had the problem where when I played a HD dvd, the output volume was so low I had to buy an amplifier and speaker set for a boost on the sound level. Well, the quality of the sound from this unit is very good, but the same problem exists for a dvd playback. So, a sound bar is probably in my future. There was a couple other features mentioned on the Amazon site for this series model about voice commands and hand signal recognition. I didn't need them, but it is not on this model anyway.(need to go to 6400 series) Overall, I have to say the picture quality is terrific and , for now, makes me happy with my purchase.--Update 4/22/14-After a week or so, the only problem I encountered is the "anynet+" feature which is supposed to let me control any other Samsung device with one remote. I do have a Samsung BluRay player, and it did control it as claimed. But it also added some kind of quirk where it reports to the TV every 10 min or so, and in the process blacks out whatever you're watching until the select button restores it. Don't know the reason yet, but I turned off that feature and it has worked well without it.

Reviews.Title: Worth it
Reviews.Author: ghinds80
Reviews.Content: I got this LED TV for my new apartment so I can watch high quality program images. It was a bit pricey, but man was it worth every penny! The smart interface just makes everything like a thousand times better too. Five stars!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Nick Luciano
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is spectacular with bright, vivid colors.  This TV is a bargain for all of the features that are included.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 60" Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I am impressed with the TV and its performance with one exception. When spending $1500 for a TV, it should have Blue Tooth capability. Without it maneuvering through the browser is very difficult as you cannot use a wireless keyboard. I worked around it by using a USB wired keyboard, but after spending that much money, it should not be necessary. I have the 6350 model and only models above 6400 have Blue Tooth. I can understand not having their smart remote included, but at least give us the opportunity to buy our own wireless keyboard.The picture on the Samsung UN60H6350 is excellent. In the end, that is why I purchased the TV. Audio is much as you would expect; with so little bezel there is little-to-no space for a decent speaker. Figure on using some kind of external audio. In my case, I used a Samsung HW-FM45C and it works very well with the TV. I can actually hear the Game of Thrones dialogue now.My satellite receiver was identified by the TV and I can now control almost all of the video, audio and STB functions from the Samsung remote. That said, I will never completely get rid of my four remotes (one for Apple TV, smart TV, sound bar and the STB). My situation was a bit different than most. I am using Shaw Direct, a Canadian satellite provider, in the US. When setting up the smart remote to ID the satellite receiver, it wants to know your zip code so it can bring up all of the cable/satellite providers in that area. Shaw Direct was not there, but, after some help from the remote assistance group, the receiver was identified and I am now able to use the smart remote for most of the Shaw Direct functions.If you get stuck on something, the remote assistance function is excellent. You get them on the phone, obtain a pin number from the TV and at that point a tech takes over control of the TV and can do any necessary trouble shooting. A really excellent time saver to have someone with extensive knowledge of the TV and system have direct access to the Samsung TV. I am very impressed with that service.All-in-all, despite the lack of Blue Tooth, I recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: A great tv for the price
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: This Smart TV is worth the investment. I have had it a little over a month now and it is awesome. Great picture, good sound out of the TV itself and the 4 HDMI ports are nice if you have a couple gaming consoles. I would recommend this TV to anyone. The apps are a cool feature so I don't have to wait for a console to start up in order to watch Netflix.

Reviews.Title: Wrong screws enclosed.
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: Had the tv sent overnight because our old Samsung tv had died. I eagerly opened the box when it arrived and attempted to attach the tv to the base stand so I could begin with the set up.  The screws they sent in the box for the bracket to attach the base stand to the television were too large for both the stand and the back of the tv.Called Samsung customer service, they said the could send new screws to me, but it would take 5-14 days, plus shipping time for them to arrive.  No expedited shipping available, even if I was willing to pay for it.They could send out a service technician, but I would have to pay for that since it was considered installation.  Even the, first available appointment was 6 days away.Packed up the tv and returned it.  Got an LG at a local store instead.Will probably never buy a Samsung product because of this experience.  All companies make mistakes, but it's how how they make good on their mistakes which set them apart.While the customer service people were helpful and polite, the Samsung policy on no expedited parts shipping is horrible.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Dave L
Reviews.Content: Picture Quality is great.  The colors are really vivid and with the auto motion plus set to smooth the images almost come alive on the screen.  The audio quality however is only so-so but I have a sound bar and sub woofer that compensate.  The only issue I have is that I have not yet been able to get the audio to play through the optical output on any of the Smart Apps.  This is really annoying because Netflix and Amazon Prime are both lower volume than normal TV and the internal speakers are OK but not great.  I have an older 46 inch Samsung from 2011 and it's the same way so I guess they still haven't fixed it.This TV is still a very good purchase at the price point considering I paid over a grand of my 2011 model when it first came out.  The quad core processor in this TV makes the response times on the apps and menus very fast.  The built-in wireless works and I was able to get connected to my wireless network during the initial set-up. The wireless doesn't pick up the SSID of my network from 2 rooms away so I had to move my wireless router.  I think this is an issue with the wireless card in the TV because I have a good signal on my laptop in the same room.I have DirecTV through HDMI 1 but I also did a channel scan with my OTA antenna which worked perfectly.  The system updated itself to the latest version of the Samsung operating system automatically and I have not had any of the reported problems with locking up or powering off.  Overall, I'm impressed with the TV.  It's a small upgrade from my previous Samsung TV and I'm happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: chris
Reviews.Content: The Samsung smart center is ok.  I do like how it connects to remote devices.  Use it as a Monitor for my computer along with being hooked up to my cable box.  Don't notice any flaws with it.  Just not a huge fan of the Smart technology.  Still has sometime to go before they will really be smart.

Reviews.Title: Best TV ever
Reviews.Author: R. Johns
Reviews.Content: We also have the 60" version of this TV (same model, just larger). Best TV ever. Looks fantastic and has the best darn picture around. Very pleased with the design and functioning of this television.

Reviews.Title: Dumbest smart device ever
Reviews.Author: Igor
Reviews.Content: The display on UN55H6350 seems pretty good, but all the "smart" features provide the dumbest experience.Bundled apps are useless and several cannot be uninstalled. It takes 15 clicks to navigateto play a movie from a network computer, but just 2 clicks to buy a movie --  you'dthink paying $800+ would be enough to opt out from additional ads.Navigation is silly as it forces one to use arrow keys, whereas using number as shortcutswould be so much more convenient (up-sell to "smart" remote?). App start up is slow(several seconds but slow enough to question if this is actually quad-core TV)

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the price range
Reviews.Author: aguy
Reviews.Content: - No real documentation. It comes with a setup guide, and a minimal user guide. Yes, it has a built in "e-guide", but it's not put together well. No illustrations, and is about as fun to read as a privacy statement.- The initial on-screen setup was pretty good & thorough. But I could not turn down the volume fast enough for the 80's video game like music playing throughout the process.- If you are wall mounting this, be aware that the mounting screws for the bracket are right next to some of the connections on the rear panel. I barely was able to connect the optical cable for my sound bar.- Picture quality is amazing.- An annoying logo pops up in the bottom right corner when using various features. Looks like a battery gauge, and thought it might be battery level for the remote. It's not. It's showing you how much power this set uses verses a conventional TV. It's not in the manual, and Samsung's website will tell you what it is after a deep search, and also that you can not disable it.- The other Eco features I like. The auto brightness adjustment seems to work well. You can tailor it to your preference.- Just like Samsung's phones, which I love, you can not delete unwanted bloat-ware apps.Navigating the internet is annoying. You're only going to do it if your laptop breaks.Streaming HD video from my Galaxy S4 directly to the TV was extremely cool.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV and PC / Game Monitor
Reviews.Author: Darrus K. Myles
Reviews.Content: Great value, Recieved in 3 days, Picture Quality is Great. Using a PC Monitor I now see game colors and shading detals that I never saw before. The 120hz Picture quality bring new and old moves to life.  I will be getting another one soon.

Reviews.Title: Good buy.
Reviews.Author: Zack S.
Reviews.Content: Was easy to setup and looks great.Only cons are that sometimes one app won't work and it always forgets my login info.

Reviews.Title: Dark shadow coming on and off
Reviews.Author: Alex  Rendon "iBook"
Reviews.Content: Just got the TV, looks great. Except after a few hours of watching it. A dark horizontal shadow line came out that's very noticeable but goes away after several minutes on it's own. Will update this later if it continues.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Smart TV 6350 LED 120 Hz 50 inch
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: I am in awe over the tv"s picture.  Installation was no problem.  All the apps work.  Only problem is getting the IR extender cable to work.  Will have a tech friend to check it out.  Don't know why quite a few people gave this outstanding Smart TV a low rating.  I would recommend this TV to anyone.

Reviews.Title: My first Flat Screen
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Finally retired my Sanyo 32" 18 year old CRT TV.  This 40" LED flat screen is great. We like to watch sports and want smooth motion. This Samsung has it all, 120 native refresh with 240 clear motion rate, wifi and all that goes with it.  Beautiful picture and sound.  Enjoying it immensely.  Having to spend time on the remote and the tv's menu as they are not at all intuitive and have to be committed to memory but once I got it, all worked well.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: Barb, Kenosha, WI
Reviews.Content: THIS IS A GREAT PURCHASE....STILL LEARNING ABOUT ALL THE FUNCTIONS. THE PICTURE IS EXTREMELY SHARP AND CLEAR.  COULDN'T BE HAPPIER. LOOKING FORWARD TO CHECKING OUT THE NEW CURVED SETS.

Reviews.Title: Good tele for the price
Reviews.Author: Hanz  M.
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this "smart" television to anyone that doesn't have one yet. Setup was a breeze. Built in wifi works great for streaming netflix/amazon video. Picture is great also.

Reviews.Title: Great color!
Reviews.Author: JanetLynn Mosemak
Reviews.Content: It is so nice to relax and watch our favorite programs on the 60". It's been mounted and the color is terrific. Watched Longmire last night and the colors were so realistic. It will be so easy to use Netflix and the other smart tv enhancements but I will wait until my son finishes the full set-up.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV - Apps ecosystem not so solid
Reviews.Author: Mitch Garnick
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this TV from another retailer.  There is a lot to like about the TV and I have no complaints about the unit itself.  I have a few older Samsung smart TVs and assumed that I would be able to download and install those same apps on this TV.  That proved to be a bad assumption.One app, Time Warner Cable, isn't available for 2014 models.  I asked Samsung about this and they directed me to ask the app developer - who hasn't bothered to respond (go figure).  Samsung does have a compatibility list but the link they gave me is specific to the app I asked about.  Check the apps you use or plan to use before purchasing a newer model TV or any TV for that matter.

Reviews.Title: Convinience is limited.
Reviews.Author: George Mann
Reviews.Content: Many settings need to be reloaded regularly.Expected more usages from my computer than exist.Brightness settings are too limited.

Reviews.Title: Good tv
Reviews.Author: dre
Reviews.Content: Picture is very good apps work well. Very stylish wish it came with smart remote. Hopefully it will be compatible soon

Reviews.Title: Love the audio control
Reviews.Author: Claudia McCaffery
Reviews.Content: We had purchased the lower model, but then found out about this model with voice command remote. The picture is beautiful and this Smart TV has it all!

Reviews.Title: A great TV - does what it promised.
Reviews.Author: Steve Leberstein
Reviews.Content: It is smart, maybe even too damned smart! Great picture, relatively easy to set up, though getting it connected to the wi-fi internet took a little doing, and programming the remote was not altogether self-evident. But it all works well.

Reviews.Title: What a picture!
Reviews.Author: Halibut52
Reviews.Content: Initially I was going for the LG 55" LED but it wasn't available form the seller so I went for the Samsung and I couldn't be more pleased.The edge to edge screen gives a feeling of endlessness. The colors & clarity are exceptional! Set up was a breeze & now I'm just exploring the Smart functions and enjoying the view.

Reviews.Title: GREAT IDEA
Reviews.Author: Judy Land
Reviews.Content: GREAT PICTURE, LOVE THE SMART SET CAPABILITY. WISH I HAD ONE IN MY LIVING ROOM NOW. YOU CAN DO YOUR FACEBOOK, NETFLIX, WHATEVER...

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Farooq Khan "khanfq"
Reviews.Content: I have not had much time to watch anything but I did play with the controls and interface. The 120hz is really what you are paying for. There's minimal blur and sharp edges around characters and objects. I would like to make one suggestion, however, and that is the quality of the sound, which could be a little better. I have noticed this to be a problem with Samsung. I have another TV in my room and the sound is very low when on a high setting. I am looking to invest in a home theater system but it is something I would like Samsung to consider improving. Other than that, it is a great TV and I plan on owning it for a very long time.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Syed Azadar Husain
Reviews.Content: This TV is a great return for money. Very good picture quality and decent smart apps function.Easy to install and connect to internet.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV so far.
Reviews.Author: Steven Trkulja
Reviews.Content: Great TV...I've had it about a month and no issues yet.  Screen is very clear and colors are very good.  Haven't used the smart features yet so I can't comment on those.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and features
Reviews.Author: Byron Moss
Reviews.Content: Picture is great and the weight of the TV is light installation on my wall was a breeze. Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great LED Set.
Reviews.Author: Arelen84 "Arelen84"
Reviews.Content: Very solid LED set. Great picture with no drop off whatsoever. This set is also very light which makes for easy wall mounting. Well worth the price. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Smarter than I am!
Reviews.Author: Migsy R.
Reviews.Content: This 40" samsung is lighter than my 6 year old 32" inch samsung. The TV looks sleek, the picture quality is great. And has decent speakers). It has plenty of connections. Plug n Play easily with other devices-especially other samsungs ( like blue ray HTS). Easy to use On screen navigation.  As my first 'smart TV' purchase, this model sure makes me feel a little dumber :-]

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: It arrived on schedule and was easy to setup.  I did have difficulty setting up wifi, but that turned out to be a problem with the modem/router.

Reviews.Title: Got it to play Xbox 1
Reviews.Author: Casey Patrick O'Brian
Reviews.Content: I went to best buy looking for a TV for my Xbox 1 and the guy I spoke with told me about this TV and how it was better than any of the TVs they had there at the time.  I wasn't looking to spend $500, but after doing so, I have zero regrets.  The only problem I had was screwing in the TV stand as it seemed like the screws weren't going in all the way.  Other than that, this TV rocks.

Reviews.Title: Super Picture
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: This 55 inch tv replaced a 5 year old 52 inch Samsung, in order to get a larger picture.  But I found that this tv had a better picture in addition.  As with all tvs, the picture has to be adjusted to the owners preference and environment.I did not try the web browsing or any apps because I am not interested in these features. The picture quality and the price made this purchase a bargain.  The set was delivered on time, set up, tested, and packaging removed by shipper (Pilot).

Reviews.Title: Another wonderful Samsung
Reviews.Author: woodmandog
