Reviews.Content: A perfect fit in the room. Super sharp picture. Very easy to set up...essentially a plug 'n play TV. I would recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: TV work great
Reviews.Author: Jfms
Reviews.Content: I got it for my new apartment bedroom. TV work great!I have been a Samsung fanatic for year, and this is not an exeption to this good products

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Ben Krueger
Reviews.Content: I have been very happy with this TV.  I have owned it for about 2 weeks now.  The speakers are OK but I have the audio going through an AV receiver.  the picture is simply awesome.  I couldn't be happier with this picture for the price range.  Yes, there are some nicer pictures out there but they cost quite a but more.  Actually a ton more.  I have no use for 3D and I really wonder if that technology will really take off.  This TV does not have 3D (I think in Amazon's description it says it does, it is not 3D).the only downfall is I have had some audio issues with the netflix app on the smart TV.  It has an odd sound, like a not syncing or loud squelch that sometimes goes off every 2 mins or every hour.  No rhyme or reason to it.  I only seem to get that when running it using my Receiver for the sound, not the TV speakers.  I am using the digital out (fiber optic) for the sound from the TV to the receiver.  So my fix is I use netflix with my Apple TV.  Same cable for the sound and I have never had this problem when I run Netflix throught the AppleTV.  It really seems to be a software issue with Samsung's Netflix.  I looked on the internet and lots of people had this issue.I highly recommend this TV to anyone who appreciates a great picture.  I also love the whats On now app to show what is on every station.

Reviews.Title: my tv, in my office
Reviews.Author: thomas r. riordan
Reviews.Content: very nice tv clear and easy to set up,bright the 120 hz seems to make a difference while watching sports

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: C. Handwohl "sweet001"
Reviews.Content: I knew it was going to be a great choice and I was right! Talk about having everything! I can surf on the internet, watch cable, play games online.... and so much more! Definitely a honey of a deal!

Reviews.Title: Best TV I' Ever Owned - My First Smart TV
Reviews.Author: R. Krikorian
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV now for a month and for my purposes, it's great and I can't really say anything negative about it.  But it is my first smart TV so I might not be the best person to critique it.  Samsung's "6350" series of smart TV's is really the top of the bottom of their model lines so it is missing certain features that others might deem essential like voice command technology and 3D functionality but I knew that before I purchased it and felt I didn't need those features for $400 - $500 more.  I can easily access my Amazon Instant Video account and if I need other convenience features, I can always get a Roku box or an Amazon Fire TV unit for under $100.

Reviews.Title: Excelleny Choise
Reviews.Author: Winston P.
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with this television although I am still learning how to use it since this is my first smart TV. I already own a SAMSUNG flat screen TV and the picture quality on the smart TV is much better.

Reviews.Title: not worth it.
Reviews.Author: robert henderson
Reviews.Content: I had same problem can not access any apps. Was told by Samsung, Amazon started selling these  new models to early would not be connected to Samsung servers till around first week of April when all apps should work. Other than that its great, beautiful picture everything else works perfect.UPDATE- 4/04/14 returned to amazon smart feature kept saying apps not supported. Was told it's a new model apps would work on 4/1 called again on 4/04 and told maybe the middle of April, really Samsung I expected better. I went to Walmart and picked up a 50" SANYO not a smart TV but picture is just as good as the Samsung. it's a new model, real thin led and only 30 lbs. And again I have to say picture is just as good and for only $428.00.

Reviews.Title: Specific quibbles
Reviews.Author: SlappyTheFrog
Reviews.Content: Really, this is a very good TV for the price, but everyone else has already made every major point that I would make. I instead would like to mention a few gotchas specific to my experiences.1. The placement of the connectors can make wall-mounting difficult: Three of the four HDMI jacks are on the right side of the TV, which is great. However, the fourth, along with the component/AV jacks, optical audio out, ethernet & the rest are on the rear panel, and aren't recessed very far. Right-angle cables or adapters are a must if you want to mount the TV as flush with the wall as possible. In addition, the fourth HDMI jack, labeled PC/DVI, is the only one that enables the TV's lower-lag "game mode." That completely baffles me, as every other TV I've seen that had a game mode, including other Samsung models, allowed it to be enabled on any HDMI port.2. The component/AV jacks are either/or: Initially, my plan was to attach a PS2, a Wii and a VCR to this TV, as the TV it replaced allowed such a configuration. Like most newer TVs, the composite and component connections are shared: the yellow composite video cable plugs into the TV's green component jack, rather than having its own dedicated jack. However, once the TV detected a blue and red component cable connected, it disabled the AV input completely, saying that option was no longer available. So much for the VCR.3. The screw holes for the TV mount are hard to fit: I'm not sure if this is more a fault of the TV or the mount I bought, but the two sets of screws included with the mount were either way too short or way too long. I ended up using a hack saw to trim the longer screws down to size.4. The TV is thick: I know this is Samsung's 'entry-level' smart TV and this is admittedly a pretty minor nitpick, but at almost 3 inches, this set seems to be a bit thick for an edge-lit LED LCD. The more expensive, but otherwise very similar H6400 is almost a half-inch skinnier than this set, which makes a noticeable difference if you're going for that flush, painting-on-a-wall look.

Reviews.Title: Applications Require Firmware (not yet developed)
Reviews.Author: Susannah Scherer
Reviews.Content: After doing some research I finally bought the Samsung Smart TV. I do not have cable, but regularly use Amazon, Netflix and Hulu. Unfortunately 5 days after connecting my new TV to the internet, and over 6 hours on the phone to customer service, I am still unable to use the applications (and they are unable to estimate when I will be able to do so). I am also unable to return my TV with the provided warranty, they are unable to exchange it, and I am forced to wait for the developers to come out with the next firmware upgrade. I am currently waiting for my next customer care call back that will occur in the next 24-48 hours. I have received some of the worst customer care I have ever experienced. I suggest that not only do you not buy this model, but you do not buy samsung if you are expected to deal with their customer care dept.

Reviews.Title: Not too Smart
Reviews.Author: T Man
Reviews.Content: The picture quality seemed fine, but the Smart features didn't work.  I returned it and got a similar model without the Smart feature for almost $200 less.Returning it through Amazon was very simple and quick.

Reviews.Title: Broken TV Base-Poor Customer Response from Amazon & Samsung!
Reviews.Author: bravesfanbb
Reviews.Content: I received this TV on May 21st and assembled the base on the 22nd.  Had me and my wife not walked away after placing the TV into the entertainment center, it would have crashed onto the floor because of the defective base and the EXTREMELY POOR DESIGN OF THE BASE!!  I called Samsung that night and they told me this was an Amazon problem!!  I called Amazon and they told me the new base had been ordered and would be delivered on that Saturday.  After several calls to both Samsung AND Amazon, I am writing this on June 4th and still have not received the base and still cannot watch my brand new TV.  Next time, I would have raised hell with Samsung and insisted they ship out a new base immediately!  Hope you have better luck because I keep seeing the Samsung 50+" TVs rated very highly but I am starting out on a very bad foot here.

Reviews.Title: Great smart tv
Reviews.Author: Bryan Patterson "bryanp354"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to use over wifi and without a set top box. It has performed beautifully. Awesome picture and many apps have made this my perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: pro
Reviews.Author: Ayanna
Reviews.Content: Love it no complaints, it was very easy to set up. The color is perfect and I even hooked it up to my wifi

Reviews.Title: Best TV I've ever owned.
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is outstanding.  In the past, I've always gone to an electronics store and compared the picture quality of multiple TVs.  The process always left me hesitant and second-guessing.  I decided to take a leap of faith by ordering this TV online, 100% based on online reviews.  Samsung was highly recommended by almost every reputable internet publication I read, various forums, and user reviews.  Aside from the amazing picture quality, the speakers sound good overall.  I usually leave the volume between 15-25, but the TV can go as high as 100.  Sound comes out clear and crisp;  even at high levels.  In summary, if you are not a sound connoisseur, it will be better than adequate.  If you are one (like me), you probably already have a separate sound system with a sub-woofer that would wake your neighbor.Unfortunately, I don't use the "Smart-TV" features very often.  If you have a PS3/X-BOX, PC, tablet, smart phone, ect., within the same room, you'll find many of these features largely-well,  useless.  In retrospect, I would have ordered a television without these features and would have saved a reasonable amount of money,The universal remote got mixed reviews.  Within the first month, I found it to be particularly fickle.  Only through trial and error did I stumble upon the appropriate solution.  The instructions state that the IR-Extender should be placed within 4 inches from cable-box's infrared receptor.  I found this to be untrue. There was no physical indication on my cable-box as to where the receptor was located.  Based strictly on experience, it is usually located somewhere behind the plexiglass that displays the time and channel.  After locating the so-called, "sweet-spot", the remote works great.  Having to switch remotes to watch TV is in the past.  Bottom line- keep the IR-extender directly in front of your cable-box's receptor.  Don't let objects come between the remote and box, the closer to a 180 degree angle of openness between the remote and receiver., the better.In closing, I'm very happy with the video and audio qualities.  The rest of the features, are amusing for about 2 minutes 30 seconds.  This LED delivers where it matters most, everything else is added fluff.  Good luck to you, and god bless,

Reviews.Title: Great set...Easy set-up...Excellent picture
Reviews.Author: ira weinman
Reviews.Content: First and most important, the picture is superb.  I had read reviews stating that set-up was difficult and the smart-tv icons (i.e. Pandora/Netflix) didn't work.  I had also read reviews stating that there were no set-up instructions/handbook included.  I'm not sure who these people are, but attaching the stand/set-up were extremely easy and a handbook WAS included.  The on-screen set-up also was very easy.  As for the smart-tv icons, again I'm not sure what these reviewers were talking about.  Once you click on the icon (i.e. for Pandora) and enter your existing account information, the screen tells you to go to their website (address included) and enter a "tv-specific" code.  Once you do that, you are immediately linked and the operation on the set is easy.  Similar for Netflix.  Surfing the web is still something that smart-tv's have to do a better job with, so not a reason to buy this set (or any others that can surf the web).  My only complaint/issue is that the universal remote enabler didn't work with my Comcast Motorola HD set-top box.  A very small issue in the scheme of things.  I would highly recommend this set and believe it gives super value for the money.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN49H6350
Reviews.Author: Charles M Reynolds
Reviews.Content: Great TV. Love all the features. Can find no problems with it. Set up real easy. The IR emitter could be better.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: DO
Reviews.Content: Replace our Sony 46" with this Samsung. Was a bit concerned of the picture quality on a large screen but was very surprised how beautiful it is. The HD is amazing with almost never any jitter. Turned off the auto bright adjust recommended in the other reviews because it was instantly annoying. Very happy I did not spend double on the next model up.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 48 inch Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Carl Spamer
Reviews.Content: Purchased one month ago and am very pleased with the high quality picture.  The remote has the smart TV feature.  I have thebasic internet speed and the internet capability is very good.  I like the 3 HDMI inputs and one optical input for surround sound.I researched TV for a long time before purchasing and am very satisfied with it's performance.  One issue is with the remote,It is supposed to be compatible with my Dish Network DVR but it is not.  So I use the satellite remote for normal use, but thenuse the Samsung remote to watch internet programming.  The internet on this TV is faster than my older samsung of 5 years ago.This is my comparison of models.  I think the picture is also better 60 htz on old TV 120 htz on new model.

Reviews.Title: Great picture but netflix app not working
Reviews.Author: Steven Halper
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to replace an old flat screen SONY (which we loved) but we wanted to add Netflix capability without swapping out our DVD. The Samsung has plenty of flexibility and the Smart TV function. However, TV would go dark trying to get Netflix up and running. Other apps worked perfectly. Spent many hours on the phone with Samsung support. They had no clue had to fix. Waiting for a software patch. In the meantime, I bought a Roku and it works perfectly. Very disappointed with this produce.

Reviews.Title: Watch out for the firmware updates
Reviews.Author: Susan P. Joyce
Reviews.Content: Sorry, folks! Wrong model - our TV is the UN40F6300 - not the UN40F6350. I'll try to move this review or delete it. VERY SORRY!!!We've had this TV for nearly a year, and have loved it. Great picture, intuitive navigation, and excellent "smart" features.However, we use an antenna to get TV and WiFi connected to our Verizon DSL. The DSL provides 1.86 Mbps downloads, not upgradable unless we want to replace copper with Verizon's FiOS fiber optic network (which I have in my work location and will not use at home because of Verizon's VERY nasty business practices and pricing over the long term). Using the DSL, we have had excellent access to the Internet for Netflix, HBO GO, Amazon Prime, TED, etc.This whole system has been working fine. Until now...This month's firmware update is nearly 700 MB. Still downloading the update (I think/hope) after 4+ hours. Contacted Samsung's "Live Chat" for help last night (somewhat useful), and they said not to interrupt the download or the install. So, left it running all night in the hope that it would finish downloading and install during the night. Instead, after about 3 hours of downloading, it apparently went to sleep for the night, like we did.So, if you have a slow Internet connection like we do, you will need to sit by the TV to hit volume on the remote to wake it up and keep the process running when the TV goes into sleep mode.Samsung provided NO warning that this was such a gigantic update - the biggest they have done since we bought the TV last summer. They should either warn people about the size of the update or break large updates into smaller chunks.If I had the chance to do this over, I would refuse the update - the TV was working just fine without it.Now, I'm keeping my fingers crossed that after the download is completed (IF that is really the problem right now), the install goes well and the TV is as usable as it was before.So, if you buy this TV, be very cautious about the updates! The TV has been unusable to us for nearly 6 hours so far...-------------UPDATE:The update did not complete over night, so I reconnected with "Live Chat" via the Samsung website, and the tech recommended that I unplug the TV for 30 seconds, plug it back in, and do the update via a USB thumb drive. That worked! But NOT like ANY of Samsung's online "help"  or instructions said it would. I downloaded the Zipped file using my PC (Mac not recommended by the Live Chat tech or the instructions), and unzipped it onto the thumb drive.[While the instructions are PC-centric, I don't think the TV really cares how you get the update file onto the thumb drive. So, I bet a Mac would work fine.]HOW TO UPDATE THIS TV USING A USB DRIVE:One set of instructions said to turn off the TV, and the other didn't specify. Once you have the update file on the thumb drive, this is how the update  worked:1. Turn off the TV.2. Plug the USB into 2nd port from the top in the back of the TV. There are 3 USB ports, each with a different name on it, and Samsung doesn't tell you which one to use. The top one didn't apparently work, but the 2nd USB port from the top DID work for this purpose.3. Turn on the TV.4. Wait 30+ seconds before clicking on the "MENU" button on the remote. Don't click sooner than 30 seconds after the TV is turned on, or you won't get the right menu options!5. Navigate to the "Support" option.6. Choose "Software Update" from the Support menu.7. Select "Update now" from the Software Update menu. While it LOOKED like that option meant it would go back to trying to download the update from the Internet (wasting time and not working), instead it accessed the USB drive and popped open a dialog box indicating that it would take a little less than an hour to do the update.8. In less than 1 hour, the update finished. The TV was not usable while it was doing the update, but the dialog box tells you what's going on and how much longer it will take to complete the update.9. When the update was completed, the TV turned itself off and then back on.10. We turned the TV back off, and removed the USB drive. Then, we turned it back on.BINGO! Update complete! And the TV is working fine, and the picture is even better than before (brighter and more clear).Samsung needs to provide better instructions online - clear, consistent, and up-to-date. The TV works fine, *when* you have useful instructions.

Reviews.Title: Software clunky and buggy
Reviews.Author: RichardNYC
Reviews.Content: Purchased this to replace an older "dumb" TV that had failed.  I already have a good AV setup with a multimedia Yamaha receiver, speakers, and a diversity of sources (e.g., AppleTV) so didn't need the "smart" features, which are just another player on the field in the scrum fighting to serve me up content.  But I figured I might as well get the 120 Hz so anted up to the higher price for this one.  Mistake.The smart features turn out to be a pain.  First thing that was a pain was the eco mode which dims the TV when the light is low.  This engages in our setup because the TV is in a cabinet and apparently there is some shadow in the cabinet that confuses the feature.  The manual goes to the trouble to tell me not to put a coffee mug in front of the TV because it confuses the ecodimming, but does not address the more plausible and common situation for people with cabinets.  While it ought to have been simple to navigate the menus to disable this for me it required a bunch of digging around through manuals and menus to finally figure out how to turn this off.  But then, that night, the TV did an auto-update of the software, which changed the setting back on, so the next day when my wife and kids were watching, they were squinting to see the picture since it was again auto-dimming, and they were clamoring about the broken new TV and how I had to fix it first thing.The user interface to the smart features is also junky.  Blank boxes appear on the home screen without their image for various app icons.  Using features requires signing up for more Internet media account (samsung.com, DivX, ...).  Other icons (e.g., Pandora) don't respond when clicked; not clear why, I didn't bother to investigate.  Moving on, within one minute of trying the web browser, the software in the TV had crashed, showing black yet backlit screen and not responding to remote.  It required physically unplugging to get it to reboot.Another odd thing about this TV is that the universal remote actually involves snaking some included long wire and IR transmitter from the TV to sit 4" in front of the main AV source (e.g., the cable set top box) and shine at its IR remote input.  While Samsung apparently couldn't be bothered to invest in software development make their software solid, they have invested to engineer this Rube Goldberg system even to the point of having the TV use my entered Zip code, cable company, etc. determine the right protocol among the possible zillions for the TV to control the cable box.  This is too weird.  It kind of makes me think of a hand reaching out of the TV to change the channel on the set top box.  And I don't have 4" of shelf in front of my cable.  And its incomplete.  What about controlling the other half dozen sources that I have from that remote.  Samsung might eliminate one remote for the set top box, but I still have 5 others.  Marginal value.  So I ignored it.Bottom line on "smart" - you probably don't want to use the smart features since they the are clunky (any cheap Blu Ray DVD will give you all the smart features you need for free, better implemented), don't work, crash the TV, and, you can't ignore them (e.g., auto-updates resetting configurations you set).All in this TV looks like it was going to be a "pest" reaching out and trying to be the controlling AV platform in the scrum among content platforms, and since it is the last step before my retina, I wasn't going to be able to turn it off and ignore it.I set up a return and I am purchasing a cheaper dumb TV.If you are thinking of getting Smart Features, I would recommend you get a dumb TV and invest the dollars you save in an AppleTV, Amazon FireTV, etc.

Reviews.Title: BEWARE: HDCP not supported!!
Reviews.Author: Valkyrie Rider "Dave"
Reviews.Content: I have this TV and it worked fine for about 6 months, then I began to get the error message "HDCP not supported" and all we got was snow on the screen. Sometimes a reboot would bring the picture back but then after about a month of fighting this we lost the picture all together. I called Samsung support and they told me it was the cable provider problem, so I called ATT U-verse and they told me it was the TV problem. I'm caught in the middle with no HDMI connectivity. I finally had to connect via component and that seems to solve the problem, however this is a new TV and should support HDMI (HDCP) protocol. HDCP is a protocol used to stop people from recording programs, but the only recording we do is with our DVR, so its a mute point. I understand that cable companies have to work with TV manufacturers to make them work together, but in this case they have not and we, the customer, pays the price of them not doing their job. Is it U-verse or Samsung?? Either will admit fault, so we are stuck using component video in a HDMI world! It sucks.

Reviews.Title: nice tv, a couple flaws
Reviews.Author: Thompson Beach
Reviews.Content: Apps are clunky.  There are several apps that are available for other Samsung models,  but not this one.My set had one bright green stuck pixel that is annoying.

Reviews.Title: Charm City Rocks
Reviews.Author: Christine Mcmichael
Reviews.Content: This Smart TV's picture quality is fantastic.  Accessories are relatively easy to follow; with some practice.  I had difficulty mounting the base to the TV. Called tech support & got great assistance.

Reviews.Title: Bought 2 of these
Reviews.Author: M. Hamilton
Reviews.Content: Found a great deal on 2 for a little more than the price of one, so we got one for each bedroom. Can't add any more about the quality that hasn't already been said.Crystal clear picture, works great with Dish and Roku. Wi-fi works great. We're completely satisfied with both of them!

Reviews.Title: Met Our Needs Exactly
Reviews.Author: SoCalGal
Reviews.Content: I don't think we could have found a better tv in this size that met our needs so exactly.  Size was a critical factor:  tv had to fit into a wall unit.  This Samsung was the right size, right price, and was really quite an update from what we previously had.  Picture quality is very good as is the sound.  We're more than satisfied.

Reviews.Title: works on the first try
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to buy this due to all the complaints about SmartHub apps not working or the tv being shipped broken.  I received mine super fast (thanks Amazon!) and setup took about an hour and a half, since I only had one person.  I think it would have gone faster with two people to unplug all the components from the old tv and put them in the right places etc.  It also had to download an update which took about 20 minutes in the middle of the setup.  Otherwise, everything works fine--Netflix and Amazon Prime both worked for me.  It is a little smaller than my old Samsung 40", because of the size of the frame, not the actual screen.  Resolution looks good from my 30 minutes of testing so far.  It is very light but somehow that makes it seem a little flimsy, particular compared with my 2008 version Samsung LCD.  I purchased the 40" for $573 and then it went to a cheaper price $544 2 days later.  I used the Amazon tv price adjustment and received a refund for the difference--this works for 14 days if you see it at a cheaper price online somewhere (not just on Amazon).  It was easy to complete the request and I received the credit quickly.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and sound
Reviews.Author: David Pfleeger
Reviews.Content: No need to get extra speakers -- great sound picture -- easy start up -- goo value -- says I need to add three more ords

Reviews.Title: Best TV I ever had
Reviews.Author: Terry "Terry P McMahon"
Reviews.Content: this TV is the bomb. The picture quality is great. Controls are very easy. Easy hook up. No problems at all connecting to my wifi system. would buy again for another room.

Reviews.Title: Great looking TV.
Reviews.Author: Kyle McKenna
Reviews.Content: Delivery was pretty slick. I was skeptical ordering a TV from the internet. Guys showed up, unboxed it, put it on the stand and tested it out before they left. I feel like it took the TV an hour or so to really warm up. The 120Hz looked pretty choppy out of the box, but everything looks great now. I do wish you could give the inputs custom names, but maybe that will come with a firmware update! The angle of viewing isn't the greatest, but the great thing about this TV is the fact that its stand is easily swivel-able. I have a lot of windows in my living room, and the matte/glossy hybrid seems to be working out pretty great. Obviously still SOME glare, but a huge improvement from the rear projection TV that was there before. I would highly recommend the 'movie' picture setting with a little bit of tweaking. Amazon Prime video streaming seems to be the least compressed, and really looks great (compared to Netflix, HBO Go, and Hulu+) Even with the TV turned off, it makes a great addition to the room, the super thin bezel is sexy. I did a lot of research before pulling the trigger on a lower end 55" TV and I am really happy with it a week into the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Robin J. W. Fisher
Reviews.Content: Set up was easy and the TV picture looks great!  The place I bought this TV from was very helpful via email regarding set up!

Reviews.Title: Packaging was awful - Missing pieces
Reviews.Author: Clifford Cook
Reviews.Content: I received this TV and was instantly skeptical. The box was battered and had definitely been resealed after being opened before. It was missing all of the components that come with the TV - remote, wall braces, SCREWS for the stand...it was missing absolutely everything that we needed to have. Not only that, but there's no place to buy any of these things as Samsung uses a specific type of screw that is not sold at most hardware stores in my area.Simply unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Harold Overcash
Reviews.Content: Good choice if you are not interested in 3D, but still want gr=eat picture and all the features that come with a smart tv.

Reviews.Title: Worked on the second time around
Reviews.Author: absbel "absbel"
Reviews.Content: Delivery time very fast but when the TV arrived, I put it together and got a neighbor to help me get it on the wall, turned it on and Voila, a thick purple vertical stripe down the middle of the screen. Samsung offered to send a technician but none has ever called to schedule the appointment as promised. Amazon quickly set up the TV to be returned and sent a new one. Got the neighbor to help me take it down, took the base off, package it up and luckily my good neighbor was willing to do it with me all over again when the second one arrived. No stripe! The TV is much nicer than the 10 year old Zenith I had but having a problem getting the picture quality right. No matter what choice I make about the picture, Natural, Standard, Movie, dynamic, it still look a video at times. I used the calibration given in another review, but I'm still fiddling with it.  The stand feels very flimsy for a 48" TV. Haven't used the Hub yet.

Reviews.Title: Not so simple
Reviews.Author: Paul D. Miller
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with the TV, but am disappointed in the set up requirements. So far the picture  resolution is not so great.

Reviews.Title: Great, No, Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Larry B.
Reviews.Content: I replaced my 8 year old 27" Samsung with this 40.To me, this was an excellent choice. Awesome picture and streams Netflix perfectly off my wireless router. That's saying a lot because my DSL is about the slowest out there 1.5M.I live in the forest and run off an outdoor antenna.  My 12 stations are perfect.One sad aspect is the inability of this 6350 to control the Samsung HW-F450 2.1 Channel 280-Watt sound bar from the TV remote.  Now it's necessary to have two remotes handy at all times. Very disappointing, but the TV rocks.The sound bar turns on and off but the optical audio out port does not control the volume of the bar. This I do not understand.I bought a Samsung sound bar believing, and was told,  they would work together off one remote.  I found out now that only the next level up has that ability.Anyway, I'm impressed with this Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Not as advertised on Amazon
Reviews.Author: Bill Coffelt
Reviews.Content: I am returning the UN50H6350. Voice Interaction as advertised on the Amazon website was not included. Also, the Samsung Smart View IOS app is not supported. I bought the H6350 as an upgrade to my two year old UN50ES6500, partly because of the smart apps being too slow. I thought a quad core processor would be a big improvement. While the H6350 is faster, I was surprised to find there are far fewer apps available and there is no app search. Several of the apps I used on my ES6500 are not available on the H6350. Picture quality is not noticeably better than my ES6500. Finally, I have learned that mirroring and Smart View will only be supported on a few Samsung devices. Voice Interaction, Smart View, and Improved Smart Apps were the primary reasons I upgraded.

Reviews.Title: Not looking good ...
Reviews.Author: Charles Evangelista
Reviews.Content: TV arrived today, let it warm up to room temp for about 4 hours and returned home to set it up...TV turned on and started setting up Wifi and what not, then it just shut off and turned back on and continues to do this every 30 seconds or so.Needless to say I'm kinda pissed but Ill let it sit overnight and call Samsung in the morning.

Reviews.Title: NOT
Reviews.Author: Megalops Atlanticus
Reviews.Content: When one buys an $850 television, it is not unreasonable to expect it to work. It is not unreasonable to expect first class service from a "big name" manufacturer. It is not unreasonable to expect a company like Samsung to go above and beyond to fix a problem like volume but no picture.  Guess I am not reasonable.Samsung does have a website for help called SPOT. Misnomer - should be called NOT. Not friendly, not helpful, and NOT a place you want to go after being on hold with the service desk on two occasions for an hour (after they accidentally cutoff the first one and did not call back).I also tried the online "help" and it informed me that a "ticket" had been formed. Site then loops and never says what happens next. Will they call? Does the Ticket fix the set? It is a Smart TV....is it smart enough to use a ticket and heal itself? Has to be smarter than the folks running service at Samsung...... because it at least has sound.I gave it a star.....sound works and since the initial service date they set is a month from now it is an expensive backup to our stereo ....which works because it was made by the other S company.

Reviews.Title: No Netflix. **AVOID THIS PRODUCT IF YOU'RE LOOKING FOR A TRUE SMART TV**
Reviews.Author: REDSAND
Reviews.Content: I bought this strictly for the ability to use Netflix. Only one problem....Samsung's Netflix app DOES NOT WORK! I spent $700 on a tv with LIMITED FEATURES. Granted the picture looks great and the functionality (minus the smart hub) is stunning. But this TV simply isn't as advertised. Don't put the Netflix logo all over your box if it won't even open on your product. Shame on you Samsung for misleading the consumer and making them waste their hard earned dollars on your bogus TV. Do not buy this tv if you're looking to use the advertised features because they do not work. Garbage.

Reviews.Title: not exactly what I expected.
Reviews.Author: Ross I.
Reviews.Content: Really? Hmmmm. Well two Things I do not like. One. Is the fact that non-HD shows do not fill the screen. Two. the refresh rate is not as good as the other flat screens I have with 120 refresh rate .. you can see constant problems with left to right motion or side to side motion on the screen.  And by the way, Samsung's tech support people can be short tempered and rude.  Not to mention the language barrier. They basically told me I'm screwed. I bought this TV under the assumption that Samsung is the best. Well, they may last longer but they haven't done some of the things that sharp has to improve the "Viewing Experience" that other manufacturers have. When you expect to see 60 inch shows on a 60 inch tv, and its like viewing a 47 inch tv.. it kinda sucks.

Reviews.Title: Smart = Dumb
Reviews.Author: John Doe
Reviews.Content: The picture and such is OK.  The real sanfu is the Smart component.  Save yourself $300 and get anything that is not Smart.  You have to enter all the commands via the hunt and peck remote.  There is no way to hook up a keyboard to this.  You may be able to use a keyboard for some things but not You Tube or Net Flex.If you want to determine who has the best TV - call their customer support.  Samsung's customer support is a joke.TV might be OK but the Smart aspect is bad.  You will be stuck with this.  It is not like the other pug ins that will be upgrading.  If Samsung ever up grades it Smart component they will want you to buy a new TV.Smart = Dumb

Reviews.Title: Defective out of the box
Reviews.Author: Robert J Nelson
Reviews.Content: Got the TV out of the box, connected it to my stereo. Got sound. No picture. Sold me a brand new TV with a burnt out bulbFAIL

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware!
Reviews.Author: Jeff O
Reviews.Content: I purchased a 55 inch Samsung LED TV from Amazon. Amazon was great. Fast and easy delivery. Unfortunately after 10 months, the TV stopped functioning at all. It made a clicking sound when you pressed the power button, but no image or sound. Fortunately, it was still under warranty. I contacted Samsung. They sent out a local repairman who fixed the TV. He mentioned it would have cost $1000 for the repair (replacing 2 circuit boards) if I was paying for it. It took him <3 minutes to switch the boards. The TV worked again. Now 2 years later - same problem. I called Samsung. They very politely told me that I was screwed. They would not fix the TV, provide parts or even a provide discount on the repair or parts despite the fact that it was the same problem the TV experienced 2 years earlier. Beware - if you do not want a very expensive paperweight after 3 years time, look at another manufacturer for your next TV.

Reviews.Title: Not turning on
Reviews.Author: Kamaraj Christopher
Reviews.Content: I got this TV yesterday and followed instruction, but it didn't turn on. Called Samsung support, but unable to fix it. This TV is made up of some cheap quality plastics. I am going to return this now. I will not suggest this TV to anyone.

Reviews.Title: after 3 months it stopped working - Warranty took 4 weeks to fix the TV
Reviews.Author: acbuyer
Reviews.Content: The TV went off 3 months after purchase.Samsung warrant will not replace, but they promise it will get fix. after 2 weeks a tech shows up and replaced the 2 only cards inside the TV. wow, it didn't work.The tech now says that the problem is the screen (the only component left), he had to order.After another week (3 so far) the tech call a says that he will be at the house at around 10:45 and he will call. My phone was out and I called at 11:00 AM.... he state that it is to late, he left the house 5 min ago and will not go back he is a mile away, he may set another appointment's  for tomorrow, one more day or maybe a weekend without TV in the leaving room !!!!Do not trust this brand. They are not committed. they will end up paying more this tech then if they have replaced the whole TV already.

Reviews.Title: Would never buy samsung again
Reviews.Author: Heidi Shelp
Reviews.Content: I ordered this tv with a needed set up time frame. Upon arrival it did not have the tv mount or screws to attach the legs to the tv. Called Samsung and an additional 10 days for the parts to come, called amazon they shipped me another tv, this tv was missing the same parts. I bought the 32 inch. Save you time and money and buy an LG. I would give this 0 stars but it doesn't allow you to.

Reviews.Title: No good for Netflix
Reviews.Author: Marcia Leatham
Reviews.Content: Netflix makes up my major tv wqtching time, and this model does NOT access Netflix. One person at Samsung said it should work by mid-April?!

Reviews.Title: bad order
Reviews.Author: jt
Reviews.Content: Purchased 9 of these. All are not as appears on website. Should have the smart remote and does not. Returning all tv's as Amazon does not know what to do. Someone, most likely Samsung, has really screwed up.
